back.text:
Root: ق و ل (Q-W-L)
Meaning: Say
Pronunciation: Qul
Tajweed Rules: Qalqalah on the 'ل' when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. قَوْل (Qawl): Saying
2. قَال (Qāla): He said
3. مَقُول (Maqūl): That which is said
4. قَائِل (Qā'il): A sayer
Example Ayah: وَقَالَ رَبُّكُمُ ادْعُونِي أَسْتَجِبْ لَكُمْ

Root: ع و ذ (`-W-DH)
Meaning: I seek refuge
Pronunciation: A'ūdhu
Tajweed Rules: Madd Tabi'i on the 'عُو'. The 'ذ' is pronounced with the tip of the tongue.
Derived Words:
1. مَعَاذ (Ma`ādh): Refuge
2. عِياذَة (`Iyādhah): Refuge-seeking
3. اسْتِعَاذَة (Isti`ādhah): Seeking protection
4. مُعِيذ (Mu`īdh): A protector
Example Ayah: فَإِذَا قَرَأْتَ الْقُرْآنَ فَاسْتَعِذْ بِاللَّهِ

hint.text: A key declaration in the Surah.

back.text:
Root: ر ب ب (R-B-B)
Meaning: In the Lord
Pronunciation: Birabb
Tajweed Rules: Tafkhīm on the 'ر' and a Shaddah on the 'ب'.
Derived Words:
1. تَرْبِيَة (Tarbiyah): Upbringing
2. رَبَّى (Rabbā): He raised
3. أَرْبَاب (Arbāb): Lords
4. رَبَّانِيّ (Rabbāniyy): Lordly
Example Ayah: بَلْدَةٌ طَيِّبَةٌ وَرَبٌّ غَفُورٌ

hint.text: The first of Allah's three attributes mentioned.

back.text:
Root: ن و س (N-W-S)
Meaning: The people, mankind
Pronunciation: An-Nās
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Shamsiyyah and Ghunna on the 'نّ'. Madd Tabi'i on 'نَا'.
Derived Words:
1. إِنسَان (Insān): A human being
2. أَنَس (Anas): Companionship
3. نَاس (Nās): People
4. أُنَاسِيّ (Unāsiyy): Human-like
Example Ayah: وَخَلَقَ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنسَانَ

hint.text: The central subject of the Surah.

back.text:
Root: م ل ك (M-L-K)
Meaning: King
Pronunciation: Maliki
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation, no Madd as in Surah Al-Fatiha's 'Māliki'.
Derived Words:
1. مَلَك (Malak): Angel
2. مُلْك (Mulk): Dominion
3. مَلَكُوت (Malakūt): Sovereignty
4. مَلِكَة (Malikah): Queen
Example Ayah: قُلِ اللَّهُمَّ مَالِكَ الْمُلْكِ

Root: أ ل ه (A-L-H)
Meaning: God, Deity
Pronunciation: Ilāh
Tajweed Rules: Madd Tabi'i on the 'ā' for 2 counts.
Derived Words:
1. أُلُوهِيَّة (Ulūhiyyah): Divinity
2. تَأَلَّهَ (Ta'allaha): To worship
3. لَاهُوت (Lāhūt): Divine nature
4. اللَّهُمَّ (Allāhumma): O Allah
Example Ayah: لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ

hint.text: The third and final attribute of Allah.

back.text:
Root: ش ر ر (Sh-R-R)
Meaning: Evil
Pronunciation: Sharri
Tajweed Rules: Tafkhīm on the 'ر' and a Shaddah on the 'ر'.
Derived Words:
1. أَشَرّ (Asharr): More evil
2. شِرَار (Shirār): Wicked ones
3. شَرِير (Sharīr): A wicked person
4. شُرُور (Shurūr): Evils
Example Ayah: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ

hint.text: The word for what we seek protection from.

back.text:
Root: و س و س (W-S-W-S)
Meaning: The whisperer
Pronunciation: Al-Waswās
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah on 'الْ'. The 'سَا' is a Madd Tabi'i.
Derived Words:
1. وَسْوَسَة (Waswasah): Whispering
2. مُوَسْوِس (Muwaswis): One who whispers
Example Ayah: فَوَسْوَسَ لَهُمَا الشَّيْطَانُ

hint.text: A description of the devil's action.

back.text:
Root: خ ن س (Kh-N-S)
Meaning: The one who withdraws
Pronunciation: Al-Khannās
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah and Ghunna on the 'نّ'. Madd Tabi'i on 'نَا'.
Derived Words:
1. خَنَسَ (Khanasa): He withdrew
2. خُنُوس (Khunūs): Withdrawal
3. خَانِس (Khānis): One who withdraws
Example Ayah: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالْخُنَّسِ

Root: ص د ر (Ṣ-D-R)
Meaning: Chests
Pronunciation: Ṣudūr
Tajweed Rules: Isti'lā (heaviness) on 'ص'. Madd Tabi'i on 'دُو'.
Derived Words:
1. صَدْر (Ṣadr): Chest
2. مَصْدَر (Maṣdar): Source
3. صَادِر (Ṣādir): Coming from
4. إِصْدَار (Iṣdār): Issuance
Example Ayah: أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ

Root: ج ن ن (J-N-N)
Meaning: The Jinn
Pronunciation: Al-Jinnah
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah and Ghunna on the 'نّ'.
Derived Words:
1. جِنّ (Jinn): Jinn
2. جَنَّة (Jannah): Garden, Paradise
3. مَجْنُون (Majnūn): Insane
4. جَنِين (Janīn): An embryo
Example Ayah: وَخَلَقَ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنْسَانَ

hint.text: One of the two sources of evil whispers.
